channel.title: Bodybuilding
channel.description:
Well I've been working out for a while ow but I want to get back into body building so I can get stronger and such. I'm having a problem with my daily diets though, because i can't eat much during the morning (1 bowl of oatmeal and a banana) and lunch (a measly 200 calorie chicken sandwich). My dinner is always my biggest meal, which usually consists of 2 apples, 2 bananas, 2 bowls of cereal that are a couple times the serving amount each, and these soy protein chicken patty things. Eating that much in one meal is not good, and it's making me start to think that I'm getting less lean, in which I most likely am. I basically just want to be lean muscle, especially because I'm going to this Halloween party where the theme is all greek and such, and leave it to my friends to tell me to dress up as a Greek fucking god so yeah.
If anyone on the forum can give me some insight, I'd be very appreciative.

item.title: Bodybuilding
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“moparscape4lifez, post:24, topic:230446”]The best way i figured out in getting a strong body is to let everything happen naturually… don’t use those sweat deodorant blockers they keep all the fat and piss inside your body and make u fat… you just gotta sweat and keep pushing ur self to the limit don’t listen to ppl who say do it 30 mins a day… u gotta do it as much as your body can take like 2 hours or even more.

Benching doesn’t help at all just for showing off… you gotta do pull ups atleast 50 try time without giving up… even if it gets hard what u got to lose… nothing yah it gets hard around 35… or so but next day you’ll get hard at 36 shows ur getting stronger

then work on ur abs

Best way to get abs I noticed is to suspend your body hanging on a pullup stick while your feet get pushed against some wall so u dont fall over and keep pulling your body with your head up to your knees or even furtherr.

There is also a easier way to do pullups you could do like 300 and you won’t even feel anything but it only works during summer, you go to the beach and swim for a hour without using your feet only hands.

Then again if ur lazy just do steroids[/quote]
Best thing for abs is definitely reverse crunches. Sit-ups shorten your hip flexors and will ruin your posture.

Buttttttttttttt, I do like the concept of that post. Most people think you need all these things like weights and stuff to keep in shape, whilst they are handy, they’re not needed. As long as you have your own body weight, you’re fine.

Read full topic

item.title: Bodybuilding
item.dc:creator: @moparscape4lifez moparscape4lifez
item.description:
@moparscape4lifez wrote:

The best way i figured out in getting a strong body is to let everything happen naturually… don’t use those sweat deodorant blockers they keep all the fat and piss inside your body and make u fat… you just gotta sweat and keep pushing ur self to the limit don’t listen to ppl who say do it 30 mins a day… u gotta do it as much as your body can take like 2 hours or even more.

Benching doesn’t help at all just for showing off… you gotta do pull ups atleast 50 try time without giving up… even if it gets hard what u got to lose… nothing yah it gets hard around 35… or so but next day you’ll get hard at 36 shows ur getting stronger

then work on ur abs

Best way to get abs I noticed is to suspend your body hanging on a pullup stick while your feet get pushed against some wall so u dont fall over and keep pulling your body with your head up to your knees or even furtherr.

There is also a easier way to do pullups you could do like 300 and you won’t even feel anything but it only works during summer, you go to the beach and swim for a hour without using your feet only hands.

Then again if ur lazy just do steroids

Read full topic

item.title: Bodybuilding
item.dc:creator: @Chimaera_God Chimaera God
item.description:
@Chimaera_God wrote:

vbcoderx:

Hmm i weigh 210 pounds… I weighed about 230 last year before school was out… Then we started summer football… I work out (weights and such) Mondays, Tuesdays, and Fridays in the mornings. On Wednesdays and Thursdays, we have football practice in the mornings. We also have 2+ hour football practice after school… I bench 180 lbs, squat twice that… Run a 40 in a 5.5. I’m 16… I eat a sausage egg muffin every morning, along with a glass of juice and 2 glasses or more of milk… I have a chicken basket for lunch (Baked fries, chicken, and a roll) and water for lunch… Then what ever my mom makes for dinner… My dad tried to get me into body building… i was like fuck that… i was tired of being sore everyday… it gets annoying…

Kick yourself in the ass and work out more. A guy your size could easily be benching 260+ and squatting at least 400. What’s your deadlift max?

Read full topic

item.title: Bodybuilding
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Chimaera God:

A lot of juice products have large amounts of sugar in them, so that’s pretty much why I don’t drink juice much.

If you buy some oranges, or other juicy fruit at the store it won’t contain much sugar. It’ll give you vitamins too. I always drink a cup of orange juice in the morning, though I’m not really sportive.

Read full topic

item.title: Bodybuilding
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

I’m 51 kilograms, and I train quite a lot and eat really well (except for Friday nights :P). I train 3 - 4 times a week for Muay Thai, the rest will be for Motocross. I normally would be predominately motocross training (which by the way a lot of you think is just a sport where you sit on a bike and twist a throttle, it’s actually a fucking tough sport), but since I have a Muay Thai fight soon, and I am not racing currently (no bike :P) I just work for Muay Thai.

Read full topic

item.title: Bodybuilding
item.dc:creator: @Chimaera_God Chimaera God
item.description:
@Chimaera_God wrote:

[quote=“TeleNubby, post:4, topic:230446”][quote author=Chimaera God link=topic=303405.msg2434126#msg2434126 date=1221083147]
I eat healthy all the time. My diet pretty much sticks to fruit, meats like fish and chicken and hardl any beef, vegetables, and stuff like oatmeal and cereal, which are about the unhealthiest things I eat. I don’t eat fast food, drink soda or juice except for OJ every other day, or any junk food like chips or snack cakes and such. Plus I drink water constantly, about 90 ounces a day along with all the exercising every day.
[/quote]What’s your excercising “routine” or “plan”?[/quote]

I basically work out every day. I’ll do legs, lats, biceps, calves, and traps one day; then chest, triceps, shoulders, and running every other day. That whole kinda thing. I run usually every day to every other day if my legs aren’t too sore, and I work my abs everyday as well.

A lot of juice products have large amounts of sugar in them, so that’s pretty much why I don’t drink juice much.

And Uriko, I just want to be leaner before I start building muscle again for the best possible results.

Read full topic
